website_summaries.verdict: The best high end memory card reader, particularly suited for media work like photography.
pros: Large CF card slot reads and writes fast
Reader is small enough to fit on most desktops or near a laptop
Fast USB 3.0 performance works without drivers
cons: It can be easy to bend a card in the CF slot unintentionally, damaging the device and card

customer_reviews.title: Six months of use
customer_reviews.text: Now that Apple has made it impossible for me to download my photos directly from the cameras, I have to rely on these little items. This one worked great right away and I was excited because I could use it for all my memory cards. I bought it in January 18 and it stopped working on June 16th.
customer_reviews.author: LAGO

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a few months then died
customer_reviews.text: When it works this is great, fast and easy to use. However, it is not durable at all. The SD slot just stopped working - the red light on top flashes, but it never recognizes the SD Card. I used a variety of SD cards from standard to high capacity, nothing. The MicroSDHC slot works fine, but the SD slot is dead. Look for a more reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Louderback

customer_reviews.title: Lightning FAST As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Check out the screen shots to see for yourself, this thing is FAST, especially when paired with a fast memory card, and USB 3.0/3.1. I am using SanDisk Extreme PRO 64GB SDXC 95 MB/s, and my PC is USB 3.1. My average transfer rate to PC is 94 MB/s. Considering my memory card is rated to 95 MB/s, I am losing virtually no speed from the card reader. What more can you say? Well it's small, looks good, and works as advertised. I have been using Kingston in my PCs forever, and only use SanDisk or Kingston memory cards, and have never had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: James JamesonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: it took so long that I gave up on the warranty replacement process and figured I would waste less time and ultimately it would be worth it ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine stopped working within 2 months of purchasing. When I contacted Kingston to try and have it replaced, it took so long that I gave up on the warranty replacement process and figured I would waste less time and ultimately it would be worth it just to order a new device made by a different company. I wish I would have initially reported the problem to Amazon, because I know they would have made the replacement process so much easier, but now I don't even want another Kingston product. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Odd behavior
customer_reviews.text: When this thing is plugged into a USB port, it allocates 4 drive letters - even if only one memory card is plugged into its slots. That is annoying. Why? IDK. You then have to fumble around to figure out which drive letter to use. All my other multi-card readers, including the cheapos from China, do not behave that way. They only allocate one drive letter, for the actual card that it plugged in. I don't know how they would handle multiple cards plugged in at the same time, but I do not expect to do that and don't know how many others would as well. Quality otherwise seems ok. Would I buy again? No.
customer_reviews.author: El Lobo

customer_reviews.title: Basic speed test: Just as fast as plugging straight into my iMac - For photography & videography
customer_reviews.text: I use this card reader to copy 4k video files from SD cards and micro SD cards onto my iMac. It's pretty fast, plugged straight into my USB 3.0 input, but I wanted to see if there would be any significant speed reduction. After all, I copy a ton of files, and I really don't want to slow down my workflow (I'm sure you can relate in a way, if you're even reading this review). ;) I wanted to see if there would be any difference in speed transferring (1/2 expecting the card reader to be *slightly* slower than plugging a card straight into my computer), but alas... zero speed slow down. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Beau Chevassus

customer_reviews.title: Works fine so far for SD cards connected via USB 3.0 or 2.0.  Was a replacement for a no-name hub that was glitchy.
customer_reviews.text: I got this in late November, 2017 to use for SD cards to transfer files on an SD card from my Sony Camcorder to my PC. This works using a USB 2.0 or 3.0 port and I got it to replace a glitchy no-name SD hub. I have had one glitch with a new Samsung SD card requiring me to run a "scan and fix" utility on the card, but it may have been the card, not the hub. The text doesn't explain, but the red logo lights up when a card is in it, and blinks when the card is accessed. So far, so good. Will update as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Jochim

customer_reviews.title: Reliable. Sturdy but ain't Purdy
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Through the my decades of working with computers and peripherals Kingston has gained a great reputation for selling reliable and quality products. The case looks retro but it is sturdy light and travels well. Each card port acts independently, so each card in one of the 4 slots will show as a separate drive. You do not have to disconnect the card reader every time you change cards as you might have to do with other card readers. It has worked reliably and quickly with every SDHC/SDXC full sized and micro card I have fed it.
customer_reviews.author: John Tanner

customer_reviews.title: disconnects constantly.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this has so many high reviews. I can't seem to go more than 4-5 minutes without the thing seeming to lose connection to my computer. This means files will fail to transfer. Even more fun when it DOES reconnect it pops up the "what to do with this device" or the explorer window which makes typing things (like this review) near impossible because I have to keep closing the explorer window.
customer_reviews.author: D. Valovcin

customer_reviews.title: Brick after Five Months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in January 2020. It worked well the few times I used it. Very fast. The most annoying thing was the useless bright red light beneath the logo that glows constantly, or at least it did. I went to use it yesterday and noticed the reader was not showing in the directory. Repeated attempts to test with different flash cards were useless. I've purchased many Kingston devices through the years; won't anymore. On the bright side, the useless red light is no longer glowing. I recommend the Lexar USB 3.0 Dual-Slot Reader, which I use at work. Four years and still going.
customer_reviews.author: Moke

customer_reviews.title: Speed Demon and Reliable Reader
customer_reviews.text: The Kingston card reader is lightening quick and precisely manufactured. CF cards are notorious for finicky behavior and fragility of the data pin array. The nice and deep design keeps the card in allignment for guaranteed transfer of images without excuses. The breakneck speed in which the device conveyed the contents to a joined laptop was quite staggering. This is the perfect reader to bring along or seat next to your favorite computer for reliable convenience of the images from the card to drive.
customer_reviews.author: QLIQ

customer_reviews.title: Great reader, may becoming obsoleted with the newest 250 MB/s SDXC II cards.
customer_reviews.text: I have had great high speed transfers approaching 150 MB/s with this reader when using Lexar Professional 1000x 128GB SDXC UHS-II Cards, and 110 MB/s on recent Silicon Power 128GB R/W up to 100/ 80MB/s Superior Pro Micro SDXC UHS-I (U3), V30 4K A1 cards. However I recently bought a Lexar Professional 1667X 128GB SDXC Uhs-II/U3 Card rated at 250 GB/s and only got 56 MB/s. So I think this reader needs an updated model to understand the 250 GB/s protocol and instead is falling back to an older standard.
customer_reviews.author: Alan N.

customer_reviews.title: ... an older media card reader and this is as easy to setup (just plug and literally play)
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older media card reader and this is as easy to setup (just plug and literally play). Also being a newer generation, transfer speeds are much better especially under usb 3.0 connections so taking full advantage of faster SD cards to offload photos and videos. Had no issues using this on Windows 7 and 10 systems, and mounted on the MacBook as well. Just the better media card reader for when your old one died like mine.
customer_reviews.author: PiyoPiyo

customer_reviews.title: A real time saver
customer_reviews.text: As a freelance audio and video contributor at my local Public Access TV station, I had to find a better way to prepare for final edits of footage I shot. Our Cannon HD cams use CF cards, and even though the final product is done in FCP 10, (I don't allow that Mac stuff in my office) I can grab the raw footage from the cards and do first, second cut project edits in Pinnacle, then finish at the station. So yeah, this reader rocks and helps me work so much longer each night than my brain would prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Greygoose53

customer_reviews.title: Great performance.  Light is pretty annoying
customer_reviews.text: Very fast and versatile card reader with the really bright light. When a card is plugged in, the logo on top lights up to indicate that the card is being read. However, the light is huge and very bright. Every time you plug in your memory cards, you'll be not-so-subtly reminded that you're using a Kingston product. USB 3.0 speed makes moving data a cinch. Also, the provided cord is a nice length. I would buy this product again, but I'd prefer an indicator light that's a bit more subtle. Deducted one star for the annoying light-up-the-room Kingston logo.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. White

customer_reviews.title: A great USB 3.0 and 2.0 interface ... with a longer cord, for desktop use.
customer_reviews.text: My Dad has one of these and its been rock solid for him. I had been using the interface on my computer which seemed to be flaky at times. Order this for myself and its been rock solid every since. Backwards compatible with USB 2.0 . I like that it lights up (red) when you insert a memory card. Thats a nice way to know its been inserted all the way. Works great and seems to work well with Windows 10. Biggest thing I like about it is the longer cord, so you can use this on your desk, even if the computer is somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Savage

customer_reviews.title: Fast; perfect for digital camera SD cards
customer_reviews.text: Transfer speeds according to CrystalDiskMark v6 software was 96MBs read and 82Mbs write using a SanDisk ExtremePro 64GB SD card. My old USB2 attached cheap reader was 19MBs which was pathetic. It's too bad they don't have an internal version thou using double stick foam tape and a 3 1/2" metal tray I made this internal running off a rear USB3 port. It uses a (what appears to be) proprietary, unusual connector for the enclosure itself so it couldn't plug into a MB header.
customer_reviews.author: videobruce

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Card Readers for a desktop
customer_reviews.text: Because of its size, roughly 3 3/4 x 2 x 3/4 in, its a bit big for travel although one could use it for that. It does read UHS-II SD cards and it the fastest card reader I own. Kingston makes another USB 3 card reader that will handle SD and micro-SD cards and is just a tad slower and very much portable. I plug this one into my desktop and just leave it there and use the smaller one for my laptop.
customer_reviews.author: David F Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible card reader
customer_reviews.text: Very fast speeds but the color and the quality feel cheap. Doesn't feel like a high end card reader. Very plasticky and has sharp edges. Update 1/12/18: The pins that connect the connector for the USB are all broken rendering the reader useless.
customer_reviews.author: Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Product DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Would give 0 if available. This product I received April 30. Worked well the fist time but stopped working on the second time. Owned only 5 days before throwing it out
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have issues with a Sabrent USB Hub
customer_reviews.text: When plugged directly in to an on board USB port, it works fine. When plugged in to my 4 port Sabrent USB hub, everything else plugged into the hub stops working. The hub has its own power supply so it should not be a power issue. So far this is the only USB device that doesn't seem to work with the Sabrent. My Lexar Multi card 25 and 1 has no issues when plugged in to the Sabrent hub, so it appears to be something with this Kingston reader.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Fast transfer
customer_reviews.text: This card reader is pretty fast and cuts transfer speeds compared to a USB 2.0 reader that I was using. One annoying thing, at least to me anyway, is the logo that blinks when not in use. The manufacturer states that it will stay off until a card is put in, then it will light up as it is transferring files. The later half is correct but on my system the first half is not true. This is a minor annoyance and can be resolved by just unplugging it when not in use. Overall this an inexpensive unit that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Believe the Other Reviewers - It is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is what folks say it is, fast, fast, fast, and all at a reasonable price. I've had no issues at all with my 128gb hi speed cards, pretty common to get in the 40-50 MB/s range upload to the card, downloads run in the 75 to 100 MB/s range for me. I do use it on a USB 3 port on my ASUS Intel board running and I5 with 8 GB, nothing special but it's a solid older machine. I take hour plus videos of sport events on a 4k sports cam, generates files 1.6 GB at a time, easily move 15-20 GB each download, very painless!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pignutr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, reliable, and not too small
customer_reviews.text: I got this one because it is "beefier" and harder to misplace around the house. I have to share it with the rest of the family and a smaller one I have kept getting misplaced. This is more right sized and easier to find in my laptop case when I do take it out and about. It is narrow, so it is more portable than I thought it would be too. Overall, I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: david1024

customer_reviews.title: I needed CF reader for USB 3.0 port
customer_reviews.text: In upgrading to a new desktop PC, unfortunately the new PC lacks support for the CF media, which is used in my dSLR. So I needed to find a USB 3 reader with CF support. I chose this product for the name recognition I had for Kingston brand, and also because it has a removable cable, not one permanently attached. A removable cable allows travel with fewer cables, rather than dedicated single-purpose cable for each device.
customer_reviews.author: Wilton

customer_reviews.title: It works!  It doesn't corrupt my cards!
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this, I went through several cheap card readers. Some of them would corrupt my cards -- I'd take a Compact Flash card out of my camera, put it in the card reader, and instantly the card becomes unreadable and all the images are destroyed. I tried it with an 8GB card and a 256GB card and it seemed the cheap readers would corrupt the 256GB card. Well, this one doesn't. It reads my cards just fine. It seems fast, too. I definitely recommend this model, or the Transcend one. The Transcend is a little smaller and I found it more aesthetically pleasing, but who cares about any of that compared to: it doesn't corrupt my data.
customer_reviews.author: A discerning consumer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work - avoid this product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this media reader since I needed a fast reader to handle lots of high quality photo and video. Unfortunately, the card reader is junk and rarely works. I've tried a number of fixes to get the card reader to allow me to access my SD card's files, but nothing has solved the issue. Very surprising considering the good reviews and heavier price tag. Avoid this reader if you want to be able to access your media. I've lost trust in the Kingston brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Kingery

customer_reviews.title: Best SD reader I have used
customer_reviews.text: Great device. Very easy to use. The light will tell you when it is safe to remove the device from your computer (or disconnect). It has a very nice design, very sleek and clean looking. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for an SD reader.
customer_reviews.author: D. D'Orazio

customer_reviews.title: A terrific device for camera operators.
customer_reviews.text: As an indie cinematographer/photographer I’ve been shuffling my SD cards through USB adapters laden with issues. After one too many corrupted cards, I decided enough was enough and ordered this Kingston card reader. This product is incredibly easy to use, it’s very functional and it supports usb 3.0 for fast transfers regardless of card type. I wanted to set it and leave it plugged in and thankfully it works flawlessly. Just plug it in and it creates new drives that correspond to each slot. Hot swapping is perfectly fine, and it’s an over all joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Palette

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Allows me to access the memory card of a digital camera of mine which is not US-spec. For some reason, I can't access the files the "usual" ways, hence my getting this reader to make things simpler and easier. The only reason I am not giving it a solid 5 is I am very picky, and feel there should be a more positive feeling when the card is inserted into the reader. No big deal. So far it works well, which is more important.
customer_reviews.author: Nells250

customer_reviews.title: Working fine far
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for a short time, but it reads all my Sandisk cards from micro to sd to Cf cards for all my dslr cameras and all my gopro device cards as well as some older stock 2 gb cards that used to come in the cell phones.. I keep those on hand for small file transfers between computers overall nice design easy to get the cf card into and out of without bending a pin. Some other readers the cf always has a bit of a loose fit and you bend a cf card pin in the reader.. and it is a mess to fix afterward..
customer_reviews.author: Davew

customer_reviews.title: There is a simple mechanical problem
customer_reviews.text: The reader works just fine if the supplied cord can make contact. I find it necessary to twist and jiggle the contact in order the get the card to function. It's not a standard contact, so using a different cord is not an option. Aha! I found the fix! The plug into the reader has tiny raised "springs" that make the contact; they can be pried up a bit to make better contact, and the reader now seems 100% dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Philip L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I bought this upon recommendation of many photographer friends and it worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: I guess card readers are not very reliable as I've yet to find one that doesn't have problems. I bought this upon recommendation of many photographer friends and it worked great at first. Lately it seems to be having trouble with uploads. At first I thought it was the memory card but it has problem with multiple cards (both CF and SD) of different brands. When it works, it's great! Just is not a consistent product so far. FYI It reads CF cards way faster.
customer_reviews.author: kwright

customer_reviews.title: Good Card Reader.  Great Design
customer_reviews.text: I'm satisfied with the with the dongle and the speed at which it reads data and pictures. I also really like the design and the fact that the top lights up when It's writing or reading data. I appreciate this fact a lot because it lights up brightly and it's easy to see. I don't have to search on the sides or bottom for a read light like my other card reader. I'm very happy with it. These are initial impressions.
customer_reviews.author: avidtech

customer_reviews.title: Deece
customer_reviews.text: Great can pull hundreds of images through on two different cards without stuttering
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: 1st one defective and quickly replaced...it happens.  And........
customer_reviews.text: First one I ordered was defective. Amazon promptly sent me a replacement which works fine. Getting a klunker was just the luck of the draw. The best thing was that Amazon promptly sent me another one. Thus 4 stars instead of 5. Give it a two star (in the background). It has a 1" x .25" bright red lighted trademark that blinks 8 times every 6 seconds...irritating. Picture an stereotypical ugly flashing sign outside of your cheap motel room window. But, did I say it works well? A piece of duct tape will fix that. I'm pretty sure I said it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reliable device to access your memory cards
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Kingston Digital USB 3.0 Hi-Speed Media Reader (FCR-HS4) to read micro SD and SD cards from my camera and phones. The Device is very easy to use, was recognized by windows 10 without drivers needed to install it. It has good transfer speeds mostly limited by my hard drive speeds and seems much faster than the older USB 2 one. It is built of brushed metal with a plastic front and is compact and light for travel. The only gripe I have is that the USB cable is on the shorter side. It is overall a solid and reliable device.
customer_reviews.author: Chemman16

customer_reviews.title: Simple, sleek and FAST
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I'm so happy using the Kingston Digital USB 3.0 Super Speed Multi-Card Reader! It's elegant, sleek, low-profiled, and - best of all - FAST! What a pleasure it is to pop in my flashcard and see the image files load up on my screen without having to sit, watch, and wait.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Saraco

customer_reviews.title: It was just what I needed to read my DSLR camera's CF cards with my Windows 10 laptop's USB3.0 port.
customer_reviews.text: It was just what I needed to read my DSLR camera's CF cards with my Windows 10 laptop's USB3.0 port. My operating system immediately recognized the Kingston Media Reader the second that I plugged in the cable to my laptop. Very happy. It will also read/write to my other memory card formats from my DSLR cameras. Recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Daryl & Norma Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job for the money
customer_reviews.text: I found out the hard way that not all card readers are created equal. So I did a little research and came up with the Kingston Digital USB 3.0 etc. etc. card reader. It blew my old card reader out of the water without breaking a sweat. And I was able to download two cards at the same time without having to babysit the computer. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dellwo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction, unreliable, not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This card reader stopped working, mostly due to cheap construction. The usb input failed so i am buying another brand to replace. The connection isn't sturdy enough to handle the usb wire, and the loose connection makes importing files off my CF card almost impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Thurmond Biggleswaddle III

customer_reviews.title: It works. And it's cheap. Noice!
customer_reviews.text: Well, it works as advertised. It's made out of plastic, but that's a given these days. Using it for SD and MicroSD cards (can't testify about CF MS/DUO etc). And it's cheap. Would be great if it was heftier, made out of metal or something, but then again that would make it pricier. Oh, well. Nevertheless, recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Schtrooklee

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine until it didn’t
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t expect this to work forever, but I did think it’d last more than a year and a half. Worked well until it died.
customer_reviews.author: JameyTucker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I had a need to download the images from my digital camera to my Windows 10 PC. Kingston is "the king" when it comes to SD cards and accessories. This device is fast and works very well. It is also small enough for travel. Excellent value for the money and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: The Tusk

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine at the starting though
customer_reviews.text: JUNK! Died within a week or two. Worked fine at the starting though, so was not DOA. Speed? I do not know......did not notice much difference from an old Sandisk USB2 card reader I have had for years.
customer_reviews.author: funkyhuman

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The first reader I bought for CF cards had pins that would easily bend. This reader guides the card into its slot much more securely. The longer USB cable is also welcome. All in all, a good card reader.
customer_reviews.author: Moreno TagliapietraTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works as You Would Expect
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the fact that my computer didn't come with an SD card reader. The guy at Best Buy recommended this one, so I gave it a shot. It works great through USB connection. Just need to figure out where to put it for my workflow.
customer_reviews.author: Frank P Centreville, VA

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after the second use. Just to be sure that it wasn't an issue with my desktop PC, I tried it on my laptop. DIdn't work there either. And yes, the SD card was fine. The built in card reader on my laptop worked fine and I was able to import the photos normally.
customer_reviews.author: Willis

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable transfers of files from card to hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my third Kingston digital card reader. Two I have used at my photography studio for several years with no issues. I have found them solid units. This new one I got for my home computer. My home computer is a few years old and it was taking a long time to transfer files. Was it the computer or the card reader? I decided to bring one of these Kingston readers home to see if it was the computer or the card reader. My old card reader was transferring 10gb of photos in 45 minutes, dam slow. With the Kingston reader, it took about 12 minutes for the same 10gb. it was that old reader after all.
customer_reviews.author: royphotog

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Solid for a card reader
customer_reviews.text: This Card Reader, is well built, I own other Card readers, and have had these for many years, if its solid structure is any indication, I am hoping it last a very long time. The others I own have served my needs just fine, for the first time, one had failed on me, I use them often, even the old USB 2.0 versions had never failed. It is wise to have several card readers, especially, when out of town.
customer_reviews.author: Review13

customer_reviews.title: Works well and fast...
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of photography and needed a good card reader. This works well and it has a much faster transfer rate than my other Transcend that often overheated. It does the SD and Micro SD (Think most of today's DSLR cameras and phones) and a CF (mostly older cameras but still found in new cameras). I just like products that do what they say without giving me any problems and this fits that requirement.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang UngerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: So far I love this, I got a new phone and couldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this, I got a new phone and couldn't import my pictures. So I had to have something. I researched and found this little gem, it has a nice long cord, lights when working and lets you know when it's done. I bought one for me and my older sis. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Cute Little Gizmo To Have
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this gizmo for micro SDHC cards with an SDHC adapter and it works very well. Since it has four slots for various card types, it comes up on the PC with a disk letter assigned for each slot. So unless you have previously slammed a title on your card, it's a guessing game which disk letter is assigned to your card. Not a big deal, a little trial and error and you find your card. After that, you always know where it is. I use this for reviewing the movies I make with my dashcam. Also loading my music files on a micro SDHC card. Gives me a warm and fuzzy feeling all over.
customer_reviews.author: Harley47

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get a faster reader to take advantage of the USB 3.0 connections. There's so much Chinese JUNK on the market these days, was delighted to find a name-brand available. While I know these too are made in China, at least Kingston has a good reputation and quality control. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hondo

customer_reviews.title: Checked it works properly and it is nice to have a high-speed reader that supports UHS-II
customer_reviews.text: Very fast shipping. Ordered from Korea and it took less than a week at only 9 bucks of shipping cost. Checked it works properly and it is nice to have a high-speed reader that supports UHS-II. I normally do not like place miscellaneous things around computer and desk, but better than using internal slow paced internal card readers. Just hope it last long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I've had the card reader for almost 4 months. When it worked it was fantastic. But it's dead now.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Kingston Card Reader does all that was promised and then some!!
customer_reviews.text: Received this as promised by Amazon / Vendor. Ten (10) minutes after receiving i was downloading four (4) different sizes of cards. This was truly a "Plug & Use" piece of hardware. The red indicator light is an added bonus I did not expect. 20-Stars
customer_reviews.author: BCSS

customer_reviews.title: It is fast :)
customer_reviews.text: The file transfer speed is impressive. At list in comparison to other, less expensive, USB 3.0 card readers I have. I also like the long USB cable which is included with the reader. My workstation/computer is on the floor next to my desk. Thanks to the long USB cable, I have reader next to keyboard and connected to the back panel of the computer. Also, I need to disclose that I use this card reader only with highest quality SDXC cards in size 32GB to 128GB, UHS-I / II.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fast Transfer
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my Kingston FCR-FS3 that recently quit reading CF cards. I am hoping that it lasts longer then the last one as it only made it past warranty. I also like the black finish of the older one over the white and silver. I bought another as I do like the performance in transferring imaged form the CF and SD cards to the computer. The USB 3.0 allows fast transfer. The cable on the new version is slightly longer than the last which is welcomed. I use three different memory cards on a regular basis which includes CF, SD and MicroSD and this card reader is a good choice to leave on my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Jack DTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Access to many memory types
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after my uncle saw mines and wanted one. I have the older generation which for some reason is more expensive which is why I bought this one for him. Does the job of allowing access to all types of memory devices using a laptop/computer.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Very nice build quality.
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how cheap these little guys are and how well they work. I've had one for years but a family member borrowed it only to never return it. This new one works just as well and I imagine will last for years to come. Super convent and in Windows 10, it's just plug and play. It's also great that you can have multiple cards plugged into it and all of them show up. Great device.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Moua

customer_reviews.title: Just Works
customer_reviews.text: It might be gaudy and big, but the damn thing works. Easy to put any type of CF, SD or microSD to work. Fast USB3 speeds and works on Mac and PC. I do like the gaudy LED light, so I do know if it's mounted and transferring data.
customer_reviews.author: Obsidian

customer_reviews.title: Real glad I got this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older Anker USB 3.0 card reader, which seemed to not be waking up the import activity in Lightroom 5.0. This Kingston device is working great - and fast! The raw, 24 mp images from my SD Extreme Pro cards immediately show up in the preview and then seem to copy into Lightroom a bit quicker - even though my iMac is still USB 2.0. I like the weight and design as it sits on my desk. It came with a plenty-long cord and so I coiled it and put a tie on it. Very pleased I upgraded.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: I don't like that the light on it flashes when I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: This works very fast! I don't like that the light on it flashes when I don't have a card in there though. I'm not sure how to disable this behavior. It's possible that it's my antivirus software too though so I don't want to ding this product for that. I just disconnect the cable when I'm not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Breakall

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of the USB 3 connector!
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I've had this card reader for 14 months and everything was fine until the USB 3 port in the back stop working. I change the cable, change where I plug it in but nothing work unless I tilt the connector of the USB 3 cable up or down little bit which I found out why when I open the case, which is very easy and fund out that the soldering housing of the USB 3 connector was unsolder, separated. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Pierre

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: I have one but needed a second one for mobility. Don't use it all that often but so now and then cannot do without. I received it and it did not work. Little I knew I needed a firmware update. That was very quickly resolved and it is working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Newbully

customer_reviews.title: Works for all cards I own
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for compact flash to download onto my computer. With new apple laptops I now also use the SD card reader for that. I have not had any issues, but be careful when putting in cards. So far - so good and I have had it a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Bird

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CARD READER !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After having too many to count card readers I finally got this Kingston card reader and WOW, it blew me away !!!!! Super fast compared to EVERYTHING else I have owned, it also has a long enough cord so its not 1 1/2 ' from my usb port AND the Kingston lights up =D THANK YOU Kingston for making a AWESOME card reader!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Unlike one reviewer I have had no problems with damage to SD cards. The biggest problem with this is that it is small and light, so it slides around. I fixed that with magnetic tape, and I stuck it to the side of my PC.
customer_reviews.author: L. Durvin

customer_reviews.title: Great While it Lasts
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly well at first, very fast and easy to use. But then one day after owning it for about 6 months, it just stopped lighting up when I plug a card into it. It simply doesn't turn on, and so nothing shows up on the PC. I'm still using the original cable an everything, and Windows still gives a little noise when i plug the cable into my PC, but nothing happens when I plug a card in.
customer_reviews.author: Austin B.

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this item about 6 months ago. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item about 6 months ago. I don't really use it that much. I just realized the device is not recognizing the multiple USB cords I've tested and can not transfer files. Clearly it is the device. I can only assume these are not design to last years, but 6 months is not sufficient time for it to be defective after regular wear and tear. Now I have to purchase a new one. This time I will purchase a name brand and see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The reader works very fast... No complaints ...
customer_reviews.text: The reader works very fast... No complaints there. But, since I started using it, various files in my media show as read only. I've made many adjustments to my Win7 Pro OS file options and the reader itself, but can't shake this problem. I returned it and have been using the Transcend Information USB 3.0 Card Reader (TS-RDF5W) instead without any problems, although if I recall correctly, the Kingston was faster at file transfer.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Review

customer_reviews.title: I only use the SD part of the reader and I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Finally hitting and holding usb 3.0 speeds that other card readers I have couldn't. This is the third brand I tried of card readers and the only one that didn't bog down when transferring large files. I only use the SD part of the reader and I'm very happy with it. It is way faster than usb 2.0 if you have 3.0 capability and fast SD or other cards.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Fast when it works, don't count on it working.  Good customer service solved the problem.
customer_reviews.text: firmware update as suggested by Kingston bricked the device. Does not register on any computer I've tried (windows 8 and windows 10). Edited: Works out of the box. Don't update firmware and you should be fine. Within 3 days of following the warranty process Kingston sent me a new unit that works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Teng

customer_reviews.title: Works with OTG cable Samsung Tab a.
customer_reviews.text: This product does work with an OTG cable. Or at least it does with my Samsung Tab a 10.5. I know someone else indicated that it didn't work with their pixel XL. I didn't try it with multiple cards at once, but it certainly recognize the SDHC card. It feels like a nice solid device.
customer_reviews.author: AzItLies

customer_reviews.title: Did not last.
customer_reviews.text: Was great while it was working, unfortunately it only lasted a few months. We used it almost daily and it may last longer with less frequent use. I will update this if there is a response from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I spent $50 on a new memory card thinking that my old card was corrupted before I borrowed another reader and found that the card was just fine. I am a photographer and can't have this ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, failed after one month of use. The wire connector is very flimsy. I have to wiggle the plug to get Windows to recognize the reader, and it still cannot read memory cards. I spent $50 on a new memory card thinking that my old card was corrupted before I borrowed another reader and found that the card was just fine. I am a photographer and can't have this happening. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie P.

customer_reviews.title: works fine but is kinda big
customer_reviews.text: The reader worked just fine right out of the box. No problems connecting it to my mac pro. I was a little surprised at how big it is. I prefer something a bit more compact, but all in all I'm satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Very fast!
customer_reviews.text: It was about time I replaced my old USB2.0 reader, transferring movies and raw pictures from my camera and drone was taking way too much time. Now I can transfer these at over 80MB/s! The only downside is the chintzy look and feel, but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to the wear and tear.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I’ve bought after my first one finally wore out after 2years (of daily use). I have used it 2-5 times a day consistently. USB 3 is great for faster cards (cf especially) and the micro sd slot is great for drones and GoPros (since I tend to lose those pesky adapters). Highly suggest.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Deering

customer_reviews.title: A nice speed boost over the older (black) version... with the right cards
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my older Kingston USB 3.0 reader (the black version that's not UHS-II compatible) since I upgraded to newer generation Lexar Pro cards and needed a reader to take advantage of the extra set of SD card contacts on the newer and faster cards. Same reliable performance as before, and the speed difference is noticeable with the right cards. My old black one still works great, and now lives in my laptop bag, while the new silver model resides (and now nicely matches) my 27" retina iMac.
customer_reviews.author: LindenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A good, fast, stable reader finally.
customer_reviews.text: Small and reliable so far, I got this mainly for an SDXC card that I got (the samsung EVO 64GB SDXC). Worked great and I didn't have any trouble with pins or seating of the card like some folks have reported with cheaper readers. Installed easily on Win10, copied my files and popped the card into my android tablet and everything is gravy. I prefer the flat-on-the-desk variety of readers to the vertical types that like to fall over all the time and this is unobtrusive and has a good performance speed.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Slightly better than the older version.
customer_reviews.text: My older version started acting up not reading my sd cards so i replaced it with this newer model. Workd great no complaints. Price is good too. It's nice that it supports uhs-II cards.
customer_reviews.author: Sev

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular speed for low price.
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular speed. Getting 154.8 MB/s read speed on a Lexar 126Gb UHS-II SD card. 110 Mb/s Write speeds. The only hitch was that at first I didn't insert the card all the way in and was getting 90/70 Mb speeds (UHS-I speeds). This will really, really cut the time down on downloading 3 hour 4K video files to my computer. The price for this performance is incredible as well. Testing was done with CrystalDiskMark v5.2.0 x64 in Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Hut

customer_reviews.title: FAST card transfers
customer_reviews.text: I had picked up another USB 3 multi-card reader and was disappointed by the transfer speeds, rarely utilizing the cards full read or write speed. This reader is fast! I have enjoyed getting to my media faster!
customer_reviews.author: thepowell

customer_reviews.title: Get it, it's fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have a built in card reader on my desktop, which is admittedly a little old. When I used it to upload my photographs to my computer it would take a VERY long time. This is especially true when I shoot with my DSLR in RAW - BIG files. I tried this in the hopes that it would be faster. Honestly, I probably saw a 4x improvement in speed. It works, it's fast, and the build quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Luis F.

customer_reviews.title: fills my needs, but should have looked around
customer_reviews.text: nothing wrong with the product. it works great. the only thing is that it feels really cheap and I am very scared about dropping it. I really do not think that it could take just one drop.
customer_reviews.author: ASHLEY

customer_reviews.title: Good card reader
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with this reader. Good transfer speeds (isn't bottlenecking any of my SD cards, but none of them are too crazy fast), I like the activity indicator light inside the Kingston branding on top (the red LED matches my custom PC), and the phaux (no it is definitely not real) brushed aluminum on top looks classy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, fast, card reader..
customer_reviews.text: It's been nice to use my new computer with 3.0 USB and this 3.0 card reader. Do a lot of photography and transfer speeds are so improved. This reader is well built and lights on top tell you that it's working. It also has a nice long cord. Didn't measure it but I'm able to reach my computers rear 3.0 USB and have this card reader on the top of my desk. Put a little double sided tape on the bottom of it so it's solid and stable on my desk. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: chris d williamsTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the item keep disabling and enabling each 5 mins it became annoying , i disconnected it and use it just when need.
customer_reviews.author: Ejmr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars - Linux or Windows
customer_reviews.text: Reader is built very well, can handle all the various SD cards and it's fast - 80ish Mb/S on some of my class 10 cards. Requires no drivers and works in both Linux and Windows. Nice lit up Kingston logo on top that flashes when it's reading/writing. Price is right too. I received no compensation for this review.
customer_reviews.author: moe_larry_cheese

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far!....Had the Lexar Multi-reader for a few years and never realized that I wasn't getting the advertised read speed on the cards I own...Plugged this bad-boy in and boom my files flew off the card. With that kind of speed you'd expect some corrupt files right?....Nothing so far, but I've known these reader to fail after some time of use......I will continue to use it and report any short comings in time. Otherwise very nice product
customer_reviews.author: Captain Wireless

customer_reviews.title: Good value !
customer_reviews.text: Initially I thought I had a problem with this card reader as it didn't seem to want to read cards. After a bit of tinkering, I discovered that the interface cable I was using between the computer and the card reader wasn't working properly. After I switched out the cable and hooked the reader up directly to the USB port, it worked fine. Kingston makes good products, I've yet to have anything of theirs not perform like it should.
customer_reviews.author: Darkstar7

customer_reviews.title: Good Speed for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well made UHS-II card reader. multi format too. The Sony MRW-S1 is a little faster but if your USB part is the in back of the computer its not as convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Worth It's Weight in Gold
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling with a card reader that was taking 2 - 8 hours to transfer Compact Flash images and video from my Canon IDX. This Kingston super speed multi-card reader makes it almost instant when it comes to transferring files. Definitely made my life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Miracle

customer_reviews.title: Easy use and well made
customer_reviews.text: I needed a reader for CF cards and use as cards too. This works really well. I like a long slot for CF cards as it is too easy in cheap readers to bend the pins
customer_reviews.author: Ian Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: It will break Guaranteed!
customer_reviews.text: CF card reader already died on me if you buy this just be warrant it will break within a month you’ve been warned the reader is crap
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cali

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for any of my micro SDs I use for my DJI Mavic Pro, Rebel T4i, Vixia r800, GoPro hero 4 silver. High transfer speeds, it stays pegged at the max rate of my sandisk extreme cards at 90MB/s. Perfect for those who need this for photography or videography purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Zer0 Productions

customer_reviews.title: Quality card reader
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality card reader and reads CF cards from professional cameras. It seems like most card readers are competing to be the cheapest and the quality generally sucks. This one is actually a very nice card reader in a sea of crappy ones.
customer_reviews.author: Vanlife Geek

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT! I am a professional photographer and (for some reason) have been using the same card reader for five years. I had no idea it could be faster! I used to wait hours for thousands of photos to upload; I would say the time is cut in about half. I am so happy with this. The light is not that annoying, and the white color makes it easy to find. I am glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

product_meta.title: Kingston Digital USB 3.0 Super Speed Multi-Card Reader for SD/SDHC/SDXC/microSD/MS/Compact Flash CF Cards (FCR-HS4), White, Brushed Nickel
product_meta.description: Kingston's USB 3.0 High-Speed Media Reader reads all major card format types and supports UHS-I and UHS-II SD card speeds, UDMA6/UDMA7 CF and MSXC cards, making it ideal for photographers, videographers, design studios, and printing houses.
feature_bullets: Ultra-portable - small size makes it an easy and convenient travel accessory
Versatile - supports memory cards and the latest speed standards including SD/SDHC UHS I-II, SDXC UHS I-II, microSDHC/microSDXC UHS-I, UDMA 0-7 Compact Flash CF Type I & II and MSXC cards
Fast – Certified SuperSpeed USB 3.0 performance for efficient and effortless high-resolution image, video recording, and other file data transfer, USB 3.0 cable included
Stylish – Sleek brushed nickel case, with an easy to read built-in LED indicator
Compliant - with USB 3.0 specifications, backwards compatible with USB 2.0.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,824 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
